quote: “Life is ours to be spent, not tobe saved.”
author: D.H. Lawrence

quote: “Your world is a living expression of how you are using and have used your mind.”
author: Earl Nightingale

quote: “Undisturbed calmness of mind is attained by cultivating friendliness toward the happy, compassion for the unhappy, delight in the virtuous, and indifference toward the wicked.”
author: Patanjali

quote: “Many people pray to be kept out of unexpected problems. Some people pray to be able to confront and overcome them.”
author: Toba Beta [Betelgeuse Incident]

quote: “Death comes to us all; we can only choose how to face it when it comes.”
author: Robert Jordan

quote: “Most people die with their music still locked up inside them.”
author: Benjamin Disraeli

quote: “Fortune does favor the bold and you'll never know what you're capable of if you don't try.”
author: Sheryl Sandberg

quote: “Today is the oldest you've ever been, and the youngest you'll ever be again.”
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quote: “Live authentically. Why would you continue to compromise something that's beautiful to create something that is fake?”
author: Steve Maraboli

quote: “When you are living the best version of yourself, you inspire others to live the best versions of themselves.”
author: Steve Maraboli

quote: “You must understand: they fear you. There is nothing scarier in their minds than a girl who knows the power of her flames.”
author: Nikita Gill

quote: “When someone is trying very hard to get something, they don't. And when they're running away from something as hard as they can, it usually catches up with them.”
author: Haruki Murakami

quote: “All I have is all I need and all I need is all I have in this moment.”
author: Byron Katie

quote: “It had never occurred to me that our lives, which had been so closely interwoven, could unravel with such speed.”
author: Kazuo Ishiguro

quote: “Life is 10 percent what happens to you and ninety percent how you respond to it.”
author: Lou Holtz

quote: “You don't always have to kiss a lot of frogs to recognize a prince when you find one -Henrietta Barett”
author: Julia Quinn

quote: “Fear not the path of Truth for the lack of People walking on it.”
author: Robert F. Kennedy

quote: “Life has no limitations, except the ones you make.”
author: Les Brown

quote: “Dancing in all its forms cannot be excluded from the curriculum of all noble education; dancing with the feet, with ideas, with words, and, need I add that one must also be able to dance with the pen?”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “I should have learned this, she thought. I wanted to learn fire, and pain, but I should have learned people.”
author: Terry Pratchett

quote: “If you care about someone enough, you’ll always be there for them no matter what.”
author: Roy T. Bennett
